description: Philip Banks III, who joined the New York Police Department in 1986 and was recently its chief of community affairs, has been appointed chief of department.
title: Philip Banks III Is Appointed Police Department Chief
title_page: Philip Banks III Is Appointed Police Department Chief - The New York Times
maintext:
Philip Banks III, the New York Police Department’s chief of community affairs, has been named chief of department, the agency’s top-ranking uniformed position.
The department’s commissioner, Raymond W. Kelly, announced the appointment Wednesday afternoon, just hours after a retirement ceremony for Joseph J. Esposito, who held the position for 12 years.
“Phil Banks has proven himself time and again to be as outstanding a field commander — adept in managing police personnel and operations,” Mr. Kelly said in a statement, adding that Chief Banks was “a consummate builder of community relations.”
